de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType extends AbstractMaterialDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DialogType - The type of the dialog, which is created by the builder
    BuilderType - The type of the builder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractValidateableDialog.Builder
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractMaterialDialog

    protected abstract static class AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType extends AbstractMaterialDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType,?>>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract base class for all builders, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder(android.content.Context context)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
      Builder(android.content.Context context, int themeResourceId)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DialogType create()
      Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been suppplied to the builder.
      android.content.Context getContext()
      Returns the context, which is used by the builder.
      protected DialogType getDialog()
      Returns the dialog, which is configured by the builder.
      protected void obtainStyledAttributes(int themeResourceId)
      Obtains all relevant attributes from the current theme.
      protected abstract DialogType onCreateDialog(android.content.Context context, int themeResourceId)
      The method, which is invoked on subclasses in order to create the dialog, which is configured by the builder.
      protected BuilderType self()
      Returns the builder itself, casted to the generic type BuilderType.

      Sets the background of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the background of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the background color of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets, whether the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be cancelable, or not.

      Sets the custom view, which should be used to show the title of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the custom view, which should be used to show the title of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the icon of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the icon of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Set the icon of the dialog, which is created by the builder.
      BuilderType setMessage(java.lang.CharSequence message)
      Sets the message of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the message of the dialog, which is created by the builder.
      BuilderType setMessageColor(int color)
      Sets the color of the message of the dialog, which is created by the builder.
      BuilderType setOnCancelListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener listener)
      Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog, which is created by the builder, is canceled.
      BuilderType setOnDismissListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener listener)
      Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog, which is created by the builder, is dismissed for any reason.
      BuilderType setOnKeyListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnKeyListener listener)
      Sets the listener, which should be notified, if a key is dispatched to the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the title of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the title of the dialog, which is created by the builder.
      BuilderType setTitleColor(int color)
      Sets the color of the title of the dialog, which is created by the builder.
      BuilderType setView(int resourceId)
      Sets the custom view, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder.
      BuilderType setView(android.view.View view)
      Sets the custom view, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder.
      DialogType show()
      Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been supplied to the builder and immediately displays it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context,
               @StyleRes
               int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

        @CallSuper
protected void obtainStyledAttributes(@StyleRes
                                                 int themeResourceId)
        Obtains all relevant attributes from the current theme.
        Parameters:
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid style resource

      • onCreateDialog

        protected abstract DialogType onCreateDialog(@NonNull
                                             android.content.Context context,
                                             @StyleRes
                                             int themeResourceId)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses in order to create the dialog, which is configured by the builder.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been created, as an instance of the generic type DialogType

      • getContext

        public final android.content.Context getContext()
        Returns the context, which is used by the builder.
        Returns:
        The context, which is used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context

      • setCancelable

        public final BuilderType setCancelable(boolean cancelable)
        Sets, whether the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be cancelable, or not.
        Parameters:
        cancelable - True, if the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be cancelable, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setOnCancelListener

        public BuilderType setOnCancelListener(@Nullable
                                       android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog, which is created by the builder, is canceled. Even in a cancelable dialog, the dialog may be dismissed for reasons other than being canceled or one of the supplied choices being selected. If you are interested in listening for all cases where the dialog is dismissed and not just when it is canceled, see setOnDismissListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type OnCancelListener, or null, if no listener should be set
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class BuilderType
        See Also:
        setCancelable(boolean), setOnDismissListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener)

      • setOnDismissListener

        public final BuilderType setOnDismissListener(@Nullable
                                              android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog, which is created by the builder, is dismissed for any reason.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type OnDismissListener, or null, if no listener should be set
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • create

        public final DialogType create()
        Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been suppplied to the builder. Calling this method does not display the dialog.
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been created as an instance of the generic type DialogType

      • show

        public final DialogType show()
        Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been supplied to the builder and immediately displays it.
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been shown, as an instance of the generic type DialogType
